description.narrative: Public administration services (land registry, business registry, etc) in Vietnam are inefficient and corrupt. Citizens and businesses suffer from non-transparent procedures, constant delay and requests for bribes for better services. Citizens are frustrated and want to change this situation, but do not know where to give feedback or how their individual feedback can reach the government. Mobile phone scorecard (M-Score) is a solution for citizens to score performance of public servants via phone calls and text messages immediately after they complete a public administration service. Their feedbacks are then compiled into rankings among public officesand published on mass media as pressure on government to improve public services. Overall objective #To improve the quality of public service that are uncorrupt and responsive to citizens # To provide citizens tools to actively request better public services vianew technology of mobile phones # Results # M-Score is expanded to cover the entire province of Quang Tri # M-Score is implemented in another province (i.e Nghe An, Quang Binh) # Activities # Computerize and share database, set up call center and text message operator to survey citizens # Analyses survey data into rankings among public offices on how well they served citizens; identify localized corruption # Publish survey results on website (www.danchamdiem.vn), through text messages to all survey citizens and provincial government leaders # Organize review workshops for public service offices to assess their performance and suggest area of support civil society organizations and government can bring to help agencies improve their services. # Inform citizens of M-Score initiative through communication products: # Mobilize mediacampaign (press release, policy dialogue on TV and radio) to apply constant pressure on government to deliver their improvement plans.

participating-org.narrative: Describe local partners: People#s Councils at Quang Binh province are elected by the people through one-party polls every five years, with the mandates of making and laws and decisions over key issues of the locality, and overseeing its implementation, especially the delivery of public services. They will manage and coordinate the application of M-Score at provincial level. Oxfam has worked with similar partner organization and similar initiative successfully before. Technical inputs have been provided for the partner. In addition, we have mobilized different resources inside and outside the country to contribute to the project. Staff time and financial resources have been allocated to this project. From the time of negotiating project with this partner, many informal systems arein place in order to resolve any arising issues. Working with this partner helps us to achieve our project and programme aims. We are clear on role and responsibilities as part of exit strategy for the project
